sections.title: Section 1: Topic Modeling Concepts and Workflow

questions.question: In the lecture example, what was the primary business benefit of topic modeling for the customer care manager?

options.A: It guarantees perfect classification of every document
options.B: It helps identify key issues and assign responsibility efficiently
options.D: It eliminates the need for data preprocessing

questions.question: **(Medium) ** Which of the following are limitations of using manual or keyword-based classification for large corpora?

options.B: It can miss rare but important issues
options.C: It is always more objective than modeling
options.D: It may introduce subjectivity from different analysts

questions.question: What is the impact of poor preprocessing on topic model quality?

options.B: It can reduce the interpretability and accuracy of topics
options.D: It always makes the document-term matrix more sparse and slower

questions.question: **(Hard) ** Put the following steps to the topic modeling workflow in order as described in the lecture:
Why might a manager prefer topic modeling over assigning a team to read and code every document?

options.A: Topic modeling is less subjective and can scale to large corpora
options.D: Manual coding always produces more consistent results

sections.title: Section 2: Model Tuning, Evaluation, and Communication

questions.question: What is the role of hyperparameters in topic modeling?

options.A: They control aspects of model training and behavior
options.B: They are only used for data cleaning
options.C: They determine the number of documents
options.D: They are irrelevant for model quality

questions.question: **(Hard) ** Which metrics or approaches are used to evaluate the fit of a topic model?
What does a high coherence score indicate about a topic?

options.A: The topic contains words that frequently occur together and make sense as a group
options.B: The topic contains words that are rarely together and are likely not related
options.C: The topic contains only stop words
options.D: The topic is not relevant to the corpus

questions.question: What is the purpose of a word intrusion task in topic modeling evaluation?

options.A: To test whether humans can identify an unrelated word in a topic list
options.B: To test whether a model can identify an unrelated word in a topic list
options.C: To count the number of topics

questions.question: **(Medium) ** According to the lecture, what are effective ways to communicate topic modeling results?

options.A: Visualizing topic prominence in the corpus
options.B: Showing topic relevance for each document
options.C: Printing all raw text in the corpus
